column5: Are we allowed to bring potatoes and apples across the border as of now? I am seeing some conflicting answers. Also I read somewhere where it tells you to not bring anything that will require you to have to go in to pay duty....in my case, beer. Has this caused anyone heartaches since the border re-opened that may have brought anything in that would require you to have to pay duty?? Thanks in advance for any replies.
your still allowed 5 cases per person, and yes you will have to go in and pay the extra duty on 4 of them . The first day they were recommending not coming in the office.
Any ideas on the potatoes and apples?

https://inspection.canada.ca/food-sa.../1389630282362 Fresh 1 bag up to 4 kilograms of US No. 1 potatoes per person and the bag must be commercially packaged 15 packages or less up to 250 kilograms of fresh fruits and vegetables per person (excluding potatoes) Must be free from soil, pests, leaves, branches and plant debris
I cant say for sure about apples, but the fellas i know that crossed yesterday took potatoes.
250 Kilos per person? I clicked on the link to make sure that wasn't a typo.... That is a lot of food....LOL
Thats an awful lot of apples and green beans ? 551 pounds per person ?
